summary: This is an FBI Laboratory Examination Request form (Serial 58) related to the death investigation of Jeffrey Epstein. It details the seizure of 18 hard drives and two DVR systems from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York following Epstein's apparent suicide on August 10, 2019. The document requests forensic examination of the digital evidence, which includes surveillance system components from the jail.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the death investigation. He was discovered unresponsive in his jail cell at the MCC with a fabricated noose around his neck in an apparent suicide.

events.title: Discovery of Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was discovered unresponsive in his jail cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Facility (MCC) in New York with a fabricated noose around his neck in an apparent suicide.

events.title: Seizure of Hard Drives from MCC
events.description: An FBI Special Agent, at the direction of NYO management, seized 18 hard drives from DVR System #2 at the MCC. The hard drives were removed from a NICE VISION PRO CCTV system server rack by an MCC Electronics Technician and handed over to the SA.

events.title: Seizure of DVR System #2
events.description: A TFO (NYPD) seized DVR System #2, a NICE VISION PRO Digital Video & Audio Recorder, from the MCC.

events.title: Seizure of DVR System #1 and Controller
events.description: An FBI Special Agent seized a Dell Powerridge 8420 DVR Controller and DVR System #1, another NICE VISION PRO Digital Video & Audio Recorder, from the MCC.

events.title: Creation of Clone Copies
events.description: Clone copies of several seized hard drives were created using forensic equipment (Tableau TX-1/TD3-8) as part of the evidence preservation process.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Facility (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the MCC on August 10, 2019, in an apparent suicide with a fabricated noose.
The FBI seized extensive digital surveillance evidence from the MCC, including 18 hard drives and two complete DVR systems, following Epstein's death.
The evidence was seized over multiple days (August 10, 14, and 15, 2019) by both FBI agents and an NYPD TFO.
The document is a formal request for the FBI Laboratory Division to conduct forensic examinations on all the seized digital evidence.
The names of the law enforcement personnel (SA, TFO) and the MCC employee (Electronics Technician) involved in the seizures are redacted in the document.
